plugins.name: Dynamic Typescales
plugins.description:
Dynamic Typescales


Automatically adjust tracking and leading across your typescale for better rhythm and readability. Tightens spacing for large text and loosens it for small text, with sliders to control intensity and inputs to set your base values. Say goodbye to tedious manual tweaking!


---


Feedback & Support


I’d love to see what you create using this plugin!

Feel free to tag me or say hi on LinkedIn or Twitter.

Bug reports, ideas, or just a thumbs-up — all are welcome 🙏

Made by Tejas Nishad

plugins.name: Detach Aliases
plugins.description:
Detach Aliases lets you resolve variable's aliased values from their sources. Easily detach a specific group of variables or all variables in a collection. You can target one mode at a time or all modes at once!


  1. Select your collection
  2. Select the target mode or all modes
  3. Enter the path to a group of variables or a single variable (see below for bulk actions)
  4. Detach


Tip

  1. Keep your variable window open to see the changes.
  2. Use the Refresh button to pull in changes to the variables made when the plugin window is open. (see below for copy & paste)
  3. Use clear to quickly delete the path.


Bulk Actions

You will most likely want to run this on a group or the entire collection:

  1. Update all variables within a group by entering the path/to/group
  2. Update all variables in the collection by entering / @all or @root in the path input
  3. You will see all variables which are located in the path and would have aliases detached in the preview panel on the left


Plugin Notes

  1. Variable names and paths are case sensitive
  2. Detaching variables, especially those linked to text styles may take longer to propagate


Copy/Paste Figma Bug

If you copy/paste variables between collections, you may need to reload the tab in order for those variables to register in their new collection.

accepted.name: Murph
accepted.description: Systems Designer • Plugin Author • Rectangle Lover

plugins.tagline: Break your collection aliases en masse!

131967.description:

131967.tagline: Break your collection aliases en masse!

plugins.tagline: Edit Scale and Blend modes for multiple images in one click

plugins.name: Screenshot to 100%
plugins.description:
The plugin quickly scales selected images to 100% of their real screenshot size in one click.


On Windows, if your display scaling (for example, 175%) is set above 100%, screenshots are captured at a larger size and look incorrect when pasted into Figma. This plugin helps you downscale screenshots so they appear correctly in Figma.


To use the plugin properly, set the same scale value in the plugin settings as in your Windows display settings.

accepted.name: Nik M
accepted.description: UX/UI/Product designer with more than 10+ years exp.

plugins.tagline: The plugin quickly scales selected images to 100% of their real screenshot size in one click.

129333.description:

On Windows, if your display scaling (for example, 175%) is set above 100%, screenshots are captured at a larger size and look incorrect when pasted into Figma. This plugin helps you downscale screenshots so they appear correctly in Figma.


To use the plugin properly, set the same scale value in the plugin settings as in your Windows display settings.
129333.tagline: The plugin quickly scales selected images to 100% of their real screenshot size in one click.

plugins.name: Colors to Variables
plugins.description:
✨ Colors to Variables


Save time and stay organized by turning your color swatches into Figma variables — automatically.


How it works:

•Select one or more frames or components

•Each must include a solid fill

•Each must contain a text layer named “Name” (this becomes the variable name)


Your palette, variable-ready.


Perfect for building or maintaining design systems with consistent, reusable color variables.
plugins.tagline: Your palette, variable-ready.

plugins.name: FileDetox
plugins.description: FileDetox is a powerful Figma cleanup tool that hunts down and eliminates the hidden clutter slowing down your design files. With its distinctive neo-brutalist interface, FileDetox quickly identifies hidden layers, empty frames, unused styles, and off-canvas elements that contribute to file bloat. In just a few clicks, purge unnecessary elements and optimize your workflow. Design with intention, not with digital baggage. Made by gautham.
plugins.tagline: Design Detoxification. Simplified.

plugins.name: MoroccanMock
plugins.description:
Design layouts more efficiently by pulling text strings, images, and cultural assets from a unique Moroccan-inspired palette. "moroccanMock" lets you create custom Moroccan-themed content and share it with other Figma users. Collaboration has never been easier!


Content:

Browse or search content to find a collection of Moroccan-inspired text strings, images, and icons. Struggling to find the perfect content? You can create your own text and image assets by using Add.


Add:

Create text categories and populate them with your own text strings. You can also upload up to 20 PNGs or JPEGs to create image content. As a creator, you may choose to share it publicly or keep it private. When you create content, it is automatically pinned to the Home Screen for quick access (signed-in users only).


Customize Your Home Screen:

Optimize your workflow by pinning the content that you use most to your home screen. Apply 1-click access to any content type with the switch of a toggle (signed-in users only). Drag and drop items on your home screen to suit your preferences.


How to use moroccanMock:

Find content:

Access saved content from your Home Screen or navigate through the tabs to search or browse content. Pin it for ease of access to your home screen.


Applying text content:

Select one or more text layers in your design to apply strings individually or apply them all. Use the original order provided or choose an order from the drop-down menu.


Applying image content:

Select one or more image layers or frames in your design, then apply the images individually or apply them all in random order.


Applying icon content:

Browse the collection or use the search bar to find a Moroccan icon. Click on the icon or drag and drop it into your design. You can also adjust the icon size to scale as needed.


Creating text and image content:

Navigate to the Add tab, click Add, and select content type. Provide a Title relevant to your content. Set your content to Public or Private. See the terms and conditions regarding usage and rights.


Anwar Bahou

LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/bahouanwar
plugins.tagline: Bring Moroccan Culture to Your Designs – Instantly

Color Palettes is a simple and intuitive plugin that helps you instantly generate and apply beautiful color palettes directly within Figma. Whether you're designing a website, mobile app, or branding project, this tool makes it easy to explore harmonious color combinations with ease.


🔹 One-click palette generation

🔹 Multiple color scheme styles (analogous, complementary, etc.)

🔹 Easily copy hex codes or apply colors to your design

Perfect for UI/UX designers, developers, and creatives looking to save time and stay inspired.


No login or external account required.

plugins.name: NornAI - Boost Your Design and Content with AI
plugins.description:
🔮 NornAI: Harness the power of artificial intelligence to transform and adapt your texts, adjusting tone and style to create unique and engaging designs. Inspired by mythology, this plugin offers a magical and personalized experience.




✨ Key Features


Text transformation with predefined tones: standard, success, error, call to action, and more.

Quick suggestions to summarize, expand, simplify, and make text more persuasive or friendly.

Image search and insertion with a special themed interface.



🛠️ How to Use


1. Text Transformation

  1. Select the desired text.
  2. Choose a voice tone or quick suggestion.
  3. Use custom prompts for specific instructions.
  4. Click on one of the generated alternatives to apply.



2. Image Search

  1. Access the "Images" tab.
  2. Enter your search and optionally select a color filter.
  3. Click on an image to insert it into the project.
plugins.tagline: Enhance your design workfklow with AI

plugins.name: Amplifi for Figma
plugins.description:
Quickly assess how intelligible and understandable your text is from directly within the Figma app. The Amplifi Intelligibility Score is our proprietary score that combines a wide range of intelligibility metrics. The score takes into consideration what words actually mean and considers how difficult those concepts are to understand. This creates a true assessment of intelligibility risk.


Key features:

  1. Instantly assess intelligibility for content frames and text nodes.
  2. See a detailed breakdown of what is causing complexity within the text.
  3. See the improvement in scoring after making edits and changes to the text.

accepted.name: Amplifi
accepted.description: Assess and simplify your regulated communications

plugins.tagline: Assess and simplify your regulated communications

138511.description:

The score takes into consideration what words actually mean and considers how difficult those concepts are to understand. This creates a true assessment of intelligibility risk.


Key features:

  3. See the improvement in scoring after making edits and changes to the text.

plugins.name: not a status
plugins.description:
Плагин для управления статусами и задачами в макетах Figma. Разработан для оптимизации рабочего процесса.

Основные возможности:

  1. Быстрое управление статусами макетов: "В процессе", "На проверку", "Не актуально", "Готово"
  2. Привязка номеров задач к макетам с автоматическим созданием кликабельных ссылок
  3. Конвертация номеров задач [...] из названия фрейма в интерактивные ссылки
  4. Настраиваемый URL-шаблон для задач
  5. Поддержка статуса "Как на проде" для готовых макетов, сверенных с продом
  6. Автоматическое создание и обновление метаданных фрейма

Как использовать:

  1. Выберите фрейм
  2. Установите нужный статус
  3. Добавьте номера связанных задач
  4. Готово! Плагин автоматически создаст метаданные и настроит все связи

Для кого:

  1. Дизайнеры
  2. Разработчики
  3. Менеджеры проектов
  4. Команды, использующие Figma в рабочем процессе

Особенности:

  1. Интуитивно понятный интерфейс
  2. Быстрый доступ к часто используемым функциям
  3. Автоматическое сохранение настроек
  4. Поддержка горячих клавиш
plugins.tagline: 🚀 Простой способ связать макеты с задачами и управлять их статусами.

plugins.name: QuickToken
plugins.description:
QuickToken is the Figma plugin that enables instant variable import and seamless organization. Designed for designers who prioritize efficiency, QuickToken allows you to quickly insert variables into Figma’s local variables as design tokens. It supports collections and groups, keeping all variables clear and organized. Simplify your variable management and speed up your workflow with this powerful, efficient plugin!


Supported name schemes:


Create Variable Collection

#Collection


Create Variable Group

Group/


Create Variable

variable-name: value


The variable type recognition is automatically

based on the variable value itself.


Supported variable types


  1. Float 30
  2. Colors #333, #334455, rgb(0,100,100), rgba(2,2,2,0.1)
  3. Boolean: true, false
  4. String: 'Hello'
  5. Variable link: var(variable-name)

accepted.name: Roland Hidvegi
accepted.description: Roland Hidvegi is a Product Designer — crafting digital experiences, from vision to final touches, passionate about creating things that make people happy.

plugins.tagline: Instant variable import and organization in Figma.

107967.description:

plugins.name: DxH - Layer2JSON
plugins.description: DxH - Layer2JSON is a Figma plugin by Devxhub Ltd. that exports design layers (text, images, shapes) to structured JSON format. Perfect for developers looking to integrate Figma designs into apps or workflows, it supports nested layers and exports essential design properties like size, position, and styles.

plugins.name: FigML - Figma XML Exporter Plugin
plugins.description:
FigML - Figma XML Exporter Plugin


Export your Figma designs to clean, structured XML. This lets you work with any programming language, any framework, and fit the code perfectly into your existing codebase. No tokens, no API calls, no headaches.


What You Get


🔍 Output That Actual Humans (and Robots) Can Read

- Preserves your Figma structure exactly as designed

- Strips away the noise: default properties and design-time clutter


🎮 Plays Nice With Everything

- Generate fresh components from scratch

- Update existing components when designs inevitably change

- Audit your component library against the latest design updates

- Create components that fit perfectly into your existing architecture

- Works with whatever you're using: React, SwiftUI, Flutter, WPF, Qt, shadcn/ui, DaisyUI, or that custom framework your team built


👑 You're the Boss

Feed the XML to any AI assistant (ChatGPT, Claude, Cursor, etc.) and get exactly the code you need. No cookie-cutter templates, no assumptions about how you like to work.


How It Works


1. Design in Figma (you're already doing this)

2. Click export (literally one click)

3. Ask your AI buddy to convert the XML

4. Ship it


Ready to stop fighting with design-to-code tools? Install FigML.

accepted.name: FigML
accepted.description: Export Figma design to XML. Simple. Clean. Powerful.

plugins.tagline: Export Figma design to XML. Simple. Clean. Powerful.

plugins.name: DeepL Translator
plugins.description:
DeepL Translator


A Figma plugin that quickly translates text within frames using the DeepL API.

The acceleration feature enables faster translations and cost savings.


Features


  1. 🚀 Fast Translation: Re-use past translation history for fast fast translation
  2. 💰️ Cost Saving: Save API Usage by Re-use past translation history
  3. 🌐 Multi-language Support: Supports 29 languages
  4. 📚 Glossary Support: Use DeepL glossaries for consistent translations
  5. 🌍 Auto Detection: Automatic source language detection
  6. 📝 Non-destructive: Creates new frames for translations while preserving originals
  7. 🎯 Simple Operation: Just select languages and click translate


How to Use


  1. Get a DeepL API key (see below)
  2. Select a frame containing text to translate
  3. Choose source and target languages
  4. (Optional) Select a glossary
  5. Click "Translate"
  6. Translation results appear in a new frame


Getting a DeepL API Key


1. Sign up for a DeepL account at DeepL Pro

  1. Free plan available (500,000 characters/month)
  2. Pro plan available for more usage

2. Get your API key:

  1. Log in to your DeepL account
  2. Go to "Account" → "API keys"
  3. Copy your API key

3. Enter your API key in the plugin settings


Supported Languages


See the complete list of supported languages for details.


Major languages include:


  1. English (EN)
  2. Chinese (ZH)
  3. Korean (KO)
  4. German (DE)
  5. French (FR)
  6. Spanish (ES)
  7. Italian (IT)
  8. Dutch (NL)
  9. Japanese (JA)
  10. Portuguese (PT)
  11. Russian (RU)


And 18 more languages


Notes


  1. DeepL API key required (available with free plan)
  2. Free plan includes 500,000 characters per month
  3. Source language must be specified when using glossaries
  4. API keys are securely encrypted and stored


Support & Feedback


We welcome your feedback! Please contact to developer through:


- Contact Form for:

  1. Questions & Inquiries
  2. Feature Requests
  3. Bug Reports
  4. General Feedback


Privacy

  1. DeepL API keys are securely encrypted
  2. Translation data is processed on DeepL servers and not stored
plugins.tagline: Translate texts in Figma by DeepL

plugins.name: Remote Variable Replacer
plugins.description:
Sometimes Figma variables aren’t coming from inside the house. While this plugin has a likely very tiny amount of potential users, if I can help anybody save any time trying to locate and replace variables that are orphans or “remote”, then this has been worth it.


For whatever reason, variables in Figma can be attached to other libraries, older files, archived files even. This can cause major headaches when editing local variables and components don’t seem to respond to the edits.


I fully expect this plugin to have a limited lifespan as Figma themselves will likely improve variable handling during copy/pastes, schema renaming or other scenarios where variables can be orphaned.


In the meantime, I got you.
plugins.tagline: Replace those pesky remote variables!

135284.name: Remote Variable Replacer
135284.description:
Sometimes Figma variables aren’t coming from inside the house. While this plugin has a likely very tiny amount of potential users, if I can help anybody save any time trying to locate and replace variables that are orphans or “remote”, then this has been worth it.


For whatever reason, variables in Figma can be attached to other libraries, older files, archived files even. This can cause major headaches when editing local variables and components don’t seem to respond to the edits.


I fully expect this plugin to have a limited lifespan as Figma themselves will likely improve variable handling during copy/pastes, schema renaming or other scenarios where variables can be orphaned.


In the meantime, I got you.
135284.release_notes:
Improved the dropdowns for numerical variables to only show local variables whose base value match the remote variable base value. This should make the plugin easy to navigate if a user has hundreds of variables.

Removed beta language; Included network access for tailwind for easy stying and unpkg.com for React. This should fix the blank screen of death. Rookie mistake!

Also updated the data security details to let users know the network access is only for static items.

134179.release_notes: Now, frames will generate at 1920x1080 regardless of zoom level; when user is zoomed way out, the blur amount wasn't sufficient. Now when a frame is generated it will always be at the set blur level - then the user can scale to any size they prefer.
134179.tagline: Generate beautiful gradient backgrounds with customizable colors & blend modes.

plugins.name: Find lost local — «Найти потерянные локальные компоненты»
plugins.description:
🔍 Find lost local automatically catches every local instance whose master component lives in another library / document.

Just set a prefix symbol (default “_”) and choose the search scope—current page or whole file.


Features

•Any nesting depth – detects instances hidden inside local components and their masters.

•Page-level grouping – shows how many problematic components each page contains.

•One-click jump – selects and zooms to the target instance.

•Custom prefix – works with _Tabs, .hidden, -draft, @deprecated, or any symbol you use for local components.


When it helps

•Before publishing a library – make sure no stray local copies remain in the file.

•During a design-system migration – quickly spot legacy components that still point elsewhere.

•While reviewing external files – instantly see what is pulled from external libraries.


How to use

1.Open the plugin and, if needed, change the prefix symbol.

2.Pick Current page or Whole file and click Search.

3.Review the grouped list. Clicking a component name jumps to its first found instance.

4.Items labelled “Outside pages” exist only inside master components; fix them in the corresponding library.


The plugin works entirely inside Figma—no internet access required, and no data ever leaves your account.


🔍 Find lost local автоматически вылавливает в вашем файле любые локальные инстансы, мастеры которых живут в другой библиотеке / документе.

Достаточно указать символ-префикс (по умолчанию — «_») и выбрать область поиска — текущую страницу или весь файл.


Возможности

  1. Любая глубина вложенности: находит инстансы, спрятанные внутри локальных компонентов и их мастеров.
  2. Группировка по страницам с подсчётом, сколько проблемных компонентов найдено на каждой.
  3. Переход одним кликом: выбирает и фокусирует нужный инстанс.
  4. Настраиваемый префикс: работает не только с «_Tabs», но и с «.hidden», «-draft», «@deprecated» — любым символом, который вы используете для локальных компонентов.


Когда пригодится

  1. Перед публикацией библиотеки — убедитесь, что в файле нет «висящих» локальных копий.
  2. Во время миграции компонентов из старой дизайн-системы в новую.
  3. При ревью сторонних файлов, чтобы сразу увидеть, что тянется из внешних библиотек.


Как пользоваться

  1. Откройте плагин и при необходимости поменяйте символ-префикс.
  2. Выберите Текущая страница или Весь файл и нажмите Поиск.
  3. Изучите сгруппированный список. Клик по названию компонента перенесёт вас к первому найденному инстансу.
  4. Компоненты, отмеченные как «Вне страницы», находятся только внутри мастеров — их можно исправить в контексте соответствующей библиотеки.


Плагин не требует интернет-доступа и не отправляет данные за пределы вашего аккаунта Figma.
plugins.tagline: Find all local component instances whose master lives in another file

plugins.name: Auto Layout Checker
plugins.description:
Auto Layout Checker helps you maintain design consistency by identifying and converting elements that don't use Auto Layout. Perfect for cleaning up designs and ensuring layout consistency across your files.


🔍 Key Features:

• Scan entire pages or selected elements for missing Auto Layout

• One-click conversion of frames and groups to Auto Layout

• Clear visual feedback for converted elements

• Theme-aware interface that matches your Figma theme

• Quick navigation to elements through direct selection


🎯 Perfect for:

• Design system cleanup and maintenance

• Legacy file modernization

• Team collaboration and consistency checks

• Quick Auto Layout implementation


💡 How to use:

1. Select elements to scan (or leave unselected to scan entire page)

2. Click "Scan" to find elements without Auto Layout

3. Click any element to navigate to it in your design

4. Use the "Convert" button to instantly apply Auto Layout


The plugin automatically applies sensible Auto Layout defaults:

• Vertical layout orientation

• 10px spacing between elements

• 10px padding on all sides

• Automatic sizing for both axes


Keep your designs maintainable and responsive with Auto Layout Checker!
plugins.tagline: Quickly find and convert elements missing Auto Layout, streamlining your design system consistency.

plugins.name: STAR Method for Figma
plugins.description:
STAR Method for Figma

Struggling to explain your design process in interviews? The STAR Method for Figma helps you:


Features:

✨ Structure case studies with {Situation - Task - Action - Result},

✨ Link stories directly to your Figma frames,

✨ Practice answering behavioral questions,

✨ Export snippets for portfolios & interviews.


How to use:

1. Open any Figma project

2. Fill in STAR sections

3. Copy your interview-ready story!


Open it in your Case Study to try Now!

plugins.name: Layer Assistant
plugins.description:
Layer Assistant is a Figma plugin for efficient layer management, featuring:

✅ Expand/Collapse – Batch expand or collapse layer structures

✅ Show/Hide – Quickly toggle layer visibility

✅ Remove Hidden Layers – Clean up all invisible layers

✅ AutoLayout Conversion – Convert AutoLayout containers to basic Frames

✅ Remove Frames/Groups – Delete empty containers while preserving content


🌟 Key Benefits

🌐 Bilingual UI (EN/CN) - Switch languages instantly

⚡ Visual Operation - No need to remember shortcuts

🛠️ Non-destructive Processing - Preserves layer properties


✅ 展开/折叠 – 批量展开或折叠图层结构

✅ 显示/隐藏 – 快速显示或隐藏所选图层

✅ 删除隐藏图层 – 清理画布上所有不可见图层

✅ AutoLayout 转换 – 将 AutoLayout 批量转为普通 Frame

✅ 移除 Frame/Group – 删除冗余容器，保留内容


🌟 独家优势

🌐 双语支持 (中/英) - 一键切换语言

⚡ 可视化操作 - 无需记忆复杂快捷键

🛠️ 无损处理 - 智能保留图层属性
plugins.tagline: Simplify your layer workflow today!

132074.name: Layer Assistant
132074.description:

✅ Expand/Collapse – Batch expand or collapse layer structures

✅ Show/Hide – Quickly toggle layer visibility

✅ Remove Hidden Layers – Clean up all invisible layers

✅ AutoLayout Conversion – Convert AutoLayout containers to basic Frames

✅ Remove Frames/Groups – Delete empty containers while preserving content


🌟 Key Benefits

🌐 Bilingual UI (EN/CN) - Switch languages instantly

⚡ Visual Operation - No need to remember shortcuts

🛠️ Non-destructive Processing - Preserves layer properties


✅ 展开/折叠 – 批量展开或折叠图层结构

✅ 显示/隐藏 – 快速显示或隐藏所选图层

✅ 删除隐藏图层 – 清理画布上所有不可见图层

✅ AutoLayout 转换 – 将 AutoLayout 批量转为普通 Frame

✅ 移除 Frame/Group – 删除冗余容器，保留内容


🌟 独家优势

🌐 双语支持 (中/英) - 一键切换语言

⚡ 可视化操作 - 无需记忆复杂快捷键

🛠️ 无损处理 - 智能保留图层属性

plugins.name: JSON -> Swatches
plugins.description:
Turn JSON into color swatches in Figma sorted by color.


Each swatch includes the color name (if given) as well as Hex and opacity values.


You can add an optional tag for extra detail if/when importing multiple libraries.


Auditing an existing design system? JSON -> Swatches is a great tool for mapping old color libraries to new.
plugins.tagline: Turn JSON into Color Swatches in Figma

plugins.name: Mode Match
plugins.description:
Mode Match lets you take a variable's value from one mode and apply it to other modes. Match a single variable, group of variables, or all variables in a collection!


  1. Select your multi-mode collection
  2. Select the source mode (copy from)
  3. Select the destination mode (copy to)
  4. Enter the path to a group of variables or a single variable (see below for bulk actions)
  5. Update ✨


Tip

  1. Keep your variable window open to see the changes.
  2. Use the Refresh button to pull in changes to the variables made when the plugin window is open. (see below for copy & paste)
  3. Use clear to quickly delete the path.


Bulk Actions

You will most likely want to run this on a group or the entire collection:

  1. Update all variables within a group by entering a path/to/group
  2. Update all variables in the collection by entering / @all or @root in the path input


Plugin Notes

  1. Collection list will only show collections with more than 1 mode
  2. Variable names and paths are case sensitive
  3. Updating variables, especially those linked to text styles may take longer to propagate


Supports

  1. All variable types (number, string, boolean, color)
  2. Aliasing
  3. Raw values


Copy/Paste Figma Bug

If you copy/paste variables between collections, you may need to reload the tab in order for those variables to register in their new collection.

accepted.name: Murph
accepted.description: Systems Designer • Plugin Author • Rectangle Lover

plugins.tagline: Match variable values across modes.

plugins.name: Icons to GitLab
plugins.description:
This plugin can help you export SVG from Figma directly to a GitLab repository.


It currently supports the following features:

- Export the selected components or instances to GitLab

- If the file already exists in the repository, it will be updated
plugins.tagline: Export SVG from Figma directly to a GitLab repository

plugins.name: Obliviate

plugins.name: Keyword-Based Ungrouper
plugins.description: This plugin allows you to ungroup elements in your Figma design based on user-specified keywords. Simply input the keywords, and the plugin will automatically find and ungroup all elements that match the criteria. Enhance your design workflow by quickly managing grouped elements with precision.
plugins.tagline: Ungroup elements based on specified keywords

plugins.name: MoveQuack
plugins.description:
Feature Overview

This plugin allows users to set customizable timers for both work and break periods, catering to individual needs.


Key Features

Customizable Timer: Set specific times for work and rest, with full flexibility.

Timed Reminders: Automatically alerts users when it's time to take a break, preventing overwork.

Boost Efficiency and Health: Helps maintain high productivity while ensuring overall well-being.


Use Cases

Perfect for users who engage in long work or study sessions, especially for professionals like designers and developers who need regular breaks.
plugins.tagline: Break Reminder Timer
